      28             : /******************************************************************************
      29             :  * mozilla::BaseEventFlags
      30             :  *
      31             :  * BaseEventFlags must be a POD struct for safe to use memcpy (including
      32             :  * in ParamTraits<BaseEventFlags>).  So don't make virtual methods, constructor,
      33             :  * destructor and operators.
      34             :  * This is necessary for VC which is NOT C++0x compiler.
      35             :  ******************************************************************************/
      36             : 
      37             : struct BaseEventFlags
      38             : {
      39             : public:
      40             :   // If mIsTrusted is true, the event is a trusted event.  Otherwise, it's
      41             :   // an untrusted event.
      42             :   bool    mIsTrusted : 1;
      43             :   // If mInBubblingPhase is true, the event is in bubbling phase or target
      44             :   // phase.
      45             :   bool    mInBubblingPhase : 1;
      46             :   // If mInCapturePhase is true, the event is in capture phase or target phase.
      47             :   bool    mInCapturePhase : 1;
      48             :   // If mInSystemGroup is true, the event is being dispatched in system group.
      49             :   bool    mInSystemGroup: 1;
      50             :   // If mCancelable is true, the event can be consumed.  I.e., calling
      51             :   // dom::Event::PreventDefault() can prevent the default action.
      52             :   bool    mCancelable : 1;
      53             :   // If mBubbles is true, the event can bubble.  Otherwise, cannot be handled
      54             :   // in bubbling phase.
      55             :   bool    mBubbles : 1;
      56             :   // If mPropagationStopped is true, dom::Event::StopPropagation() or
      57             :   // dom::Event::StopImmediatePropagation() has been called.
      58             :   bool    mPropagationStopped : 1;
      59             :   // If mImmediatePropagationStopped is true,
      60             :   // dom::Event::StopImmediatePropagation() has been called.
      61             :   // Note that mPropagationStopped must be true when this is true.
      62             :   bool    mImmediatePropagationStopped : 1;
      63             :   // If mDefaultPrevented is true, the event has been consumed.
      64             :   // E.g., dom::Event::PreventDefault() has been called or
      65             :   // the default action has been performed.
      66             :   bool    mDefaultPrevented : 1;
      67             :   // If mDefaultPreventedByContent is true, the event has been
      68             :   // consumed by content.
      69             :   // Note that mDefaultPrevented must be true when this is true.
      70             :   bool    mDefaultPreventedByContent : 1;
      71             :   // If mDefaultPreventedByChrome is true, the event has been
      72             :   // consumed by chrome.
      73             :   // Note that mDefaultPrevented must be true when this is true.
      74             :   bool    mDefaultPreventedByChrome : 1;
      75             :   // mMultipleActionsPrevented may be used when default handling don't want to
      76             :   // be prevented, but only one of the event targets should handle the event.
      77             :   // For example, when a <label> element is in another <label> element and
      78             :   // the first <label> element is clicked, that one may set this true.
      79             :   // Then, the second <label> element won't handle the event.
      80             :   bool    mMultipleActionsPrevented : 1;
      81             :   // If mIsBeingDispatched is true, the DOM event created from the event is
      82             :   // dispatching into the DOM tree and not completed.
      83             :   bool    mIsBeingDispatched : 1;
      84             :   // If mDispatchedAtLeastOnce is true, the event has been dispatched
      85             :   // as a DOM event and the dispatch has been completed.
      86             :   bool    mDispatchedAtLeastOnce : 1;
      87             :   // If mIsSynthesizedForTests is true, the event has been synthesized for
      88             :   // automated tests or something hacky approach of an add-on.
      89             :   bool    mIsSynthesizedForTests : 1;
      90             :   // If mExceptionWasRaised is true, one of the event handlers has raised an
      91             :   // exception.
      92             :   bool    mExceptionWasRaised : 1;
      93             :   // If mRetargetToNonNativeAnonymous is true and the target is in a non-native
      94             :   // native anonymous subtree, the event target is set to mOriginalTarget.
      95             :   bool    mRetargetToNonNativeAnonymous : 1;
      96             :   // If mNoCrossProcessBoundaryForwarding is true, the event is not allowed to
      97             :   // cross process boundary.
      98             :   bool    mNoCrossProcessBoundaryForwarding : 1;
      99             :   // If mNoContentDispatch is true, the event is never dispatched to the
     100             :   // event handlers which are added to the contents, onfoo attributes and
     101             :   // properties.  Note that this flag is ignored when
     102             :   // EventChainPreVisitor::mForceContentDispatch is set true.  For exapmle,
     103             :   // window and document object sets it true.  Therefore, web applications
     104             :   // can handle the event if they add event listeners to the window or the
     105             :   // document.
     106             :   // XXX This is an ancient and broken feature, don't use this for new bug
     107             :   //     as far as possible.
     108             :   bool    mNoContentDispatch : 1;
     109             :   // If mOnlyChromeDispatch is true, the event is dispatched to only chrome.
     110             :   bool    mOnlyChromeDispatch : 1;
     111             :   // If mOnlySystemGroupDispatchInContent is true, event listeners added to
     112             :   // the default group for non-chrome EventTarget won't be called.
     113             :   // Be aware, if this is true, EventDispatcher needs to check if each event
     114             :   // listener is added to chrome node, so, don't set this to true for the
     115             :   // events which are fired a lot of times like eMouseMove.
     116             :   bool    mOnlySystemGroupDispatchInContent : 1;
     117             :   // If mWantReplyFromContentProcess is true, the event will be redispatched
     118             :   // in the parent process after the content process has handled it. Useful
     119             :   // for when the parent process need the know first how the event was used
     120             :   // by content before handling it itself.
     121             :   bool mWantReplyFromContentProcess : 1;
     122             :   // The event's action will be handled by APZ. The main thread should not
     123             :   // perform its associated action. This is currently only relevant for
     124             :   // wheel and touch events.
     125             :   bool mHandledByAPZ : 1;
     126             :   // True if the event is currently being handled by an event listener that

     129             :   // If mComposed is true, the event fired by nodes in shadow DOM can cross the

     132             :   // Similar to mComposed. Set it to true to allow events cross the boundary

     135             :   // Set to true for events which are suppressed or delayed so that later a

     138             :   // was suppressed or delayed in contents side.

     735             : 
     736             : /******************************************************************************
     737             :  * mozilla::NativeEventData
     738             :  *
     739             :  * WidgetGUIEvent's mPluginEvent member used to be a void* pointer,
     740             :  * used to reference external, OS-specific data structures.
     741             :  *
     742             :  * That void* pointer wasn't serializable by itself, causing
     743             :  * certain plugin events not to function in e10s. See bug 586656.
     744             :  *
     745             :  * To make this serializable, we changed this void* pointer into
     746             :  * a proper buffer, and copy these external data structures into this
     747             :  * buffer.
     748             :  *
     749             :  * That buffer is NativeEventData::mBuffer below.
     750             :  *
     751             :  * We wrap this in that NativeEventData class providing operators to
     752             :  * be compatible with existing code that was written around
     753             :  * the old void* field.
     754             :  ******************************************************************************/
     755             : 
     756           0 : class NativeEventData final
     757             : {
     758             :   nsTArray<uint8_t> mBuffer;
     759             : 
     760             :   friend struct IPC::ParamTraits<mozilla::NativeEventData>;
     761             : 
     762             : public:
     763             : 
     764             :   explicit operator bool() const
     765             :   {
     766           0 :     return !mBuffer.IsEmpty();
     767             :   }
     768             : 
     769             :   template<typename T>
     770           0 :   explicit operator const T*() const
     771             :   {
     772           0 :     return mBuffer.IsEmpty()
     773             :            ? nullptr
     774           0 :            : reinterpret_cast<const T*>(mBuffer.Elements());
     775             :   }
     776             : 
     777             :   template <typename T>
     778           0 :   void Copy(const T& other)
     779             :   {
     780             :     static_assert(!mozilla::IsPointer<T>::value, "Don't want a pointer!");
     781           0 :     mBuffer.SetLength(sizeof(T));
     782           0 :     memcpy(mBuffer.Elements(), &other, mBuffer.Length());
     783           0 :   }
     784             : 
     785             :   void Clear()
     786             :   {
     787           0 :     mBuffer.Clear();
     788             :   }
     789             : };
